intro: Palicourea chrysorrhachis, commonly known as golden-stemmed palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, yellowish stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or humid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
